content: in the depths of winter freezing winds whip up the coasts frothing the waves into peaking whitecaps that crash against the shore the whitecaps scarf uses fisherman s rib to mimic the foaming waves and to keep you cozy as you explore the stunning icy scenery the whitecaps scarf matches with the frozen seas mittens 1 this pattern is also available for free on my blog 2 **sizes** there are two sizes in the pattern a scarf size and a wrap size the scarf has a width of 20cm / 8 and a length of 175cm / 70 and the wrap has a width of 50cm / 20 and a length of 190cm / 76 **yarn and yardage** the sample is knit in de rerum natura ulysse 100% nsw merino 202 yards / 50g in the colourway poivre blanc the yardage is approx 800 - 2130 yards 4 - 11 skeins **notions** knitting needles dpns or circulars and a darning needle **techniques** this pattern is suitable for beginner knitters it uses the knit below stitch a link to the tutorial is in the pattern > join my newsletter 3 to hear about new patterns and blog posts and get access to exclusive discounts 1 https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/frozen-seas 2 https //www classicsongbird ca/blog/free-knitting-pattern-whitecaps 3 https //www classicsongbird ca/knitters-newsletter
